boat.name: Cine Mara
boat.full_description:
The lines for 'Cine Mara' were taken and drawings made by Joe Murphy from Dublin. He provided Dutchman, Rik Janssen, with these plans for building his first Hooker the ‘Moorhen’. ‘Cine Mara’ is the second Hooker in Holland, and one of the very few sailing outside Ireland.

Transferring the original concept of the half-decked open boat to the fully decked one that is ‘Cine Mara’, together with Rik being a Dutchman, led to the choice of steel as building material. It gives more headroom and space inside and she still keeps her typical rounded skin. In 2009 the keel was laid in the yard of Gerard Kroes, in Leeuwarden, and during the following years Rik finished her ready to launch in 2012.

The aim of the fully decked copy was the wish to sail her further away from home waters in Holland. So the second year of her floating existence she joined the OGA Round Britain Challenge in 2013. She attracted much attention everywhere she showed up, and needless to say, especially in her ‘home’ waters of Ireland. Here the rightful critics admitted her into the genuine Hooker fleet, but only after having her baptised with a small drop of ‘Irish’ Holy water, where the rest of the bottle had to be finished by the crew.
boat.short_description: The 'Cine Mara' is a Galway Hooker, built on the lines of the famous ‘Truelight’ from Ireland, by Dutchman, Rik Janssen in the Netherlands.
